summary: This is the last will and testament of Jeffrey E. Epstein, dated August 8, 2019, which designates executors for his estate and bequeaths all his property to The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2018 Trust. The document outlines extensive powers granted to the executors for managing and distributing the estate. This is the Last Will and Testament of Jeffrey E. Epstein, executed on May 8, 2018. It details the disposition of his estate, including provisions for taxes, beneficiaries, and the establishment of a trust. The document includes witness signatures and a notary public's certification.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: The individual whose will is being executed; he is the testator and the primary subject of the document.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.context: Appointed as one of the primary executors of Jeffrey Epstein's will.

persons.name: Richard D. Kahn
persons.context: Appointed as one of the primary executors of Jeffrey Epstein's will alongside Darren K. Indyke.

persons.name: Kathryn H. Ruemmler
persons.context: Designated as the successor executor if either Darren K. Indyke or Richard D. Kahn is unable or unwilling to serve.

persons.name: Habibe Avdiu
persons.context: Notary public who certified the signing of the will on May 8, 2018, in New York County.

connections.description: Epstein appointed Indyke as an executor of his will, indicating a relationship of trust for managing his estate.
Epstein appointed Kahn as an executor of his will, indicating a relationship of trust for managing his estate.
Both are appointed as co-executors of Epstein's will, requiring them to work together in managing the estate.
Epstein designated Ruemmler as the successor executor, indicating a backup plan for estate administration.

events.title: Execution of Epstein's Will
events.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein signed his last will and testament, designating executors and bequeathing his estate to a trust.

events.title: Creation of The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2018 Trust
events.description: The trust agreement for The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2018 Trust was established, which is the beneficiary of Epstein's entire estate under his will.

events.title: Execution of Jeffrey Epstein's Will
events.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein signed his Last Will and Testament in the presence of witnesses and a notary public.

locations: St. Thomas, United States Virgin Islands
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's entire estate is bequeathed to The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2018 Trust, dated May 8, 2018.
Darren K. Indyke and Richard D. Kahn are appointed as the primary executors, each to receive $250,000 upon completion of probate.
Kathryn H. Ruemmler is designated as the successor executor if either primary executor cannot serve.
The will grants executors extremely broad powers to manage, invest, sell, and distribute estate assets without needing judicial approval.
The document includes provisions to disinherit any beneficiary who contests the will or the trust.
Jeffrey Epstein's will was executed on May 8, 2018, just over a year before his death in August 2019.
The will establishes a trust (referred to as 'the Trust Agreement') for the disposition of his estate, with detailed provisions for tax payments and asset distribution.
It includes a 'no contest' clause, stating that any beneficiary who challenges the will shall have their bequest voided.
The document specifies that taxes on assets not passing under the will or trust ('Apportionment Assets') should be apportioned among recipients, with the executor having discretion to pay them.
The will was notarized by Habibe Avdiu, a Notary Public in New York, with a commission expiring on October 14, 2010, though the will was signed in 2018.
